data.title: 2024 Commencement Program
data.text:
Assad I. Turfe embodies a lifelong commitment to public service and Wayne County that began as an entry-level deputy in the Sheriff’s Office in 2002. Hailing from Dearborn, Turfe swiftly ascended through the ranks, eventually becoming one of the youngest lieutenants in the department's history. His extensive law enforcement background spans various divisions within the Sheriff’s Office, where he honed his problem-solving skills and leadership abilities.

In 2015, Turfe transitioned to the Office of the Wayne County Executive, leveraging his deep understanding of County government to navigate complex challenges. His exceptional problem-solving skills and instinctive leadership qualities propelled him from Chief Assistant to Chief of Staff and currently, Deputy Wayne County Executive.

Throughout his career, Turfe has demonstrated a remarkable aptitude for fostering collaboration and driving transformative initiatives. His role as Deputy Wayne County Executive requires him to manage the day-to-day operations of Wayne County Government, ensuring the seamless coordination of County departments and addressing the diverse needs of all 43 communities within Wayne County.

Amidst the unprecedented challenges posed by the COVID-19 pandemic, Turfe emerged as a unifying force, bringing together stakeholders from across Wayne County to navigate the crisis effectively. His ability to forge meaningful connections and bridge communication gaps proved instrumental in mobilizing resources and providing critical support to residents and local officials.

Turfe's proactive approach and ability to handle any Wayne County crisis have earned him a reputation as a dependable leader. He is consistently at the forefront, spearheading efforts to coordinate responses and attract resources from all 43 communities, ensuring a unified and effective approach to addressing challenges and serving the needs of Wayne County’s residents.

Turfe's dedication to continuous learning and professional development is evident in his academic achievements, including a bachelor’s degree in public policy from Concordia University. Additionally, he is a distinguished graduate of The Young American Leaders Program at the Harvard Business School, where he delved into topics such as Managing Yourself and Others and Behavioral Decision-Making. Turfe further honed his leadership skills through completion of the Staff and Command program, an executive Leadership initiative at Eastern Michigan University.

As one of the premier problem-solvers in government, Turfe remains committed to driving positive change and advancing the interests of Wayne County. His unwavering dedication, coupled with his exceptional leadership abilities, continue to shape the trajectory of our community.
